extends java.lang.Object

    A Clause - a set of literals.

      • setParentsRuleAndSub

        public void setParentsRuleAndSub(java.util.List<Clause> par,
                        boolean ris,
                        boolean ordinata,
                        Substitution sub)
        Set parents that generate the clause with wich inference rule (resolution or semplification) with or without ordering specified the used substitution
        Parameters:
        par - list of clauses parents of the clause
        ris - true if used rule is resolution, false if semplification
        ordinata - true if ordering is used, false otherwise
        sub - the substitution used (empty substitution if not used)

      • setParentsRuleAndSub

                        Substitution sub)
        Set parent that generate the clause with factorization with or without ordering specified the used substitution
        Parameters:
        par - parent clause
        ordinata - true if used ordering
        sub - substitution used (empty substitution if not used)

      • applySubstitution

        public Clause applySubstitution(Substitution tau,
                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Variable> vars,
                       long time)
        Constructs a new clause from the application of the given substitution to the clause. (Note: apply ' to distinguish variables with equals name (and different index) example: in case of x_3 and x_4 --> x_newIndex and x'_newIndex
        Parameters:
        tau - substitution
        vars - map of variables and new name given in the results
        time - index of the new clause
        Returns:
        the new clause if the substitution modify the clause this if the substitution has no effects.
